channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2024030178
item.description:
Report E-2024030178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: BAKERSFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBF experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide release from (2) 50-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25 pounds of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to a forklift accident. The damaged bags and released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining bags were re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE OF DETERGENT WITH 3 INCH CRACK BEHIND THE HANDLE WITH 2 TENTHS OF A GALLON LOSS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED AND NEUTRALIZED WITH PH9 AND DUSTPAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2024030172
item.description:
Report E-2024030172

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: BREA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 29, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1789 was crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, tires, and asphalt parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. PES crews utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads on the impacted trailer and tires. The deployed granular absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. Crews deployed a neutralizing solution onto the impacted asphalt and worked them in with hand tools. All UN1789-impacted material was collected and containerized into the previously generated 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

DescribePack: 1 of the plasctic container had its lid popped open spilling the content and soiled the rest of the package. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic lined container and any spill was wiped with an absorbent pad.

item.title: Report E-2024030157
item.description:
Report E-2024030157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum, and they deployed granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, PPE, and any cleanup debris was staged in the terminal's waste holding room along with the 85-gallon salvage drum that contained the damaged drum. All undamaged freight was staged on the dock for further handling by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report E-2024030150
item.description:
Report E-2024030150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-gallons of UN2672 Ammonium Hydroxide (10-35%) released from a 5-gallon poly jug due to a forklift puncture impacting a 1'X5' area of the trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Absorbents were applied in the trailer and swept up. Soda Ash solution was used to neutralize the impacted area. Impacted absorbents, PPE and the empty jug were containerized and overpacked into one 55-gallon poly drum of waste and staged in terminal OS&D for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021924
item.description:
Report X-2024021924

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: ROMOLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A THREE DAY SELECT AIR PACKAGE WAS OBSERVED WITH FROST BUILDUP ON THE OUTSIDE AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX IS A PREPRINTED ZEP CONCENTRATED ALL-PURPOSE CLEANER BOX WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS AND "PROTECT FROM FREEZING NOT FOR AIR TRANSPORT" PREPRINTED ON THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND LESS THAN APPOXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 98568E, KHARTUNERZ, 41421 DATE ST, SUITE 108, MURRIETA CA 92562.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND, LEAKING ON THE IR BELT. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED BY RESPONDER, AREA WAS CLEANED, AND PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024021779
item.description:
Report X-2024021779

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2024021779 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered by the power turn for the NCs to be scanned. Once discovered we promptly cleaned the material up and placed it in a proper setup to be brought back to the Hazardous cage to be processed. DescribePack: Inside the box there is a plastic pail. On the bottle of the plastic pail, it opened. The whole entire bottom of the Plastic pail is falling off and it is leaking all of its powder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazardous bag alongside a proper red tote to contain all the release. What released was swept up and placed in the proper bag/tote as well. 2. X-2024021782 SequenceEvent: Package was found at the power turn where we process NCs. Package was discovered and quickly cleaned up and placed in a hazmat bag and also in a red tote to be processed in our hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package has failure in the plastic pail inside the Box. It is cracked heavily at the bottom and is leaking a lot of its inner contents inside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazmat bag to catch all of the powder that is releasing from the plastic pail. The contents that leaked was also placed in the hazmat bag.
